Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Father James P. Hayes, St. Andrews R.C. Church, Cardinal Hayes Place, New York, NY  10007.

Council Member Gonzalez moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.MinutesNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of January 19 and February 2, 2005 be adopted and printed by Council Member Clarke.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Angela Mariana Freyre to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her reappointment to the New York City Conflicts of Interest Board, Pursuant to Section 2602 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Angela Mariana Freyre, Conflicts of Interest Board

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Andrew Irving to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the New York City Conflicts of Interest Board, Pursuant to Section 2602 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Andrew Irving, Conflicts of Interest Board

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Submitting Preliminary Mayor’s Management Report (PMMR) for Fiscal Year 2005.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting Preliminary Mayor’s Management Report (PMMR) for Fiscal Year 2005.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups
Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling upon the Governor and New York State Legislature to execute the Memorandum of Understanding required for the implementation of the landmark 2003 New York State Brownfield Cleanup Program and distribution of funding through the Brownfield Opportunity Areas Program.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Execute the Memorandum of Understanding required for the implementation of the landmark 2003 NYS Brownfield Cleanup Program.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance

Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for a property located at 3161 Brighton 6th Street (Block 8693, Lot 12), Brooklyn, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 408).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 408 - Section 202 Supportive Housing Program for the Elderly, Scheuer House of Brighton Beach, 3161 Brighton 6th Street, Brooklyn, CD#13.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities.

Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 522-A, Creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities following inspections where violations are identified.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to study the long-term effects of living and working near multiple antennas and base stations.

Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Study the long-term effects of living and working near multiple antennas and base stations.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Transportation
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creation of a review process in the event of the closure of a publicly mapped street.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creation of a review process in the event of the closure of a publicly mapped street.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the public authorities law to provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated in passenger service on lines in the New York City transit system that travel through tunnels, under a body of water, or over a bridge; or during instances when trains in passenger service are composed of more than four cars, or are greater than three hundred sixty feet in length, or are able to carry a passenger load of more than 750 persons.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Transportation
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Provide for a minimum staffing level of one conductor and one operator on trains operated on safety-sensitive lines in the NYC transit system.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to stem cell research.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Stem Cell Research

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the expenditure of payments in lieu of taxes and requiring a monthly report on the collection and use of all such payments to the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Expenditure of payments in lieu of taxes and requiring a monthly report on the collection and use of all such payments to NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution mourning the death and celebrating the life of Peter Zvi Malkin, the man who captured Adolph Eichmann.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Mourning the death and celebrating the life of Peter Zvi Malkin.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the second anniversary of the beginning of the war in Iraq on March 19, 2005, and calling on President George W. Bush to immediately withdraw all American troops from Iraq and further urging the United States Congress to reject the President’s request for additional funds for the war while at the same time making budget cuts to vital domestic programs.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the second anniversary of the beginning of the war in Iraq on March 19, 2005.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to support Congressman Charles Rangel’s proposed legislation, H.R. 677, which would grant permanent resident status to Amadou Diallo’s family members: Kadiatou Diallo, Laouratou Diallo, Ibrahima Diallo, Abdoul Diallo, Mamadou Bobo Diallo, Mamadou Pathe Diallo, Fatoumata Traore Diallo, Sankarela Diallo and Marliatou Bah.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Congress to support Congressman Charles Rangel’s proposed legislation, H.R. 677, which would grant permanent resident status to Amadou Diallo’s family members.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass the Count Every Vote Act of 2005, introduced in the Senate by Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton and in the House by Representative Stephanie Tubbs Jones, a comprehensive package of pro-democracy, pro-voter legislation that contains the Civic Participation Act of 2005, a measure to restore voting rights in Federal elections to ex-offenders who have completed their sentences.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass the Count Every Vote Act of 2005.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an annual Fire Department terrorism response drill.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Annual Fire Department terrorism response drill.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to hazardous materials training for the emergency medical service.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Hazardous materials training for the emergency medical service.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the re-establishment of a Fire Cadet program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Re-establishment of a Fire Cadet program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reforming the ranking procedure for the open competitive firefighter exam.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Reforming the ranking procedure for the open competitive firefighter exam.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing separate women’s bathrooms and showers in all New York City firehouses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Providing separate women’s bathrooms and showers in all NYC firehouses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to joint training by the hazardous materials teams of the New York City Fire Department and the New York City Police Department.
Items.AgendaNote: Fire and Criminal Justice Services and Public Safety
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Joint training by the hazardous materials teams of the NYC Fire Department and the NYC Police Department.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to adopt legislation protecting the right to earn overtime pay and reversing the affects of detrimental new federal regulations that significantly weaken overtime protections.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Protecting the right to earn overtime pay.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending funeral benefits to New York City auxiliary police officers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Extending funeral benefits to New York City auxiliary police officers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to tighten advertising restrictions in the federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act and to allow localities to legislate in this area, in order to reduce the exposure of youth to tobacco advertising.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Congress to tighten advertising restrictions in the federal Cigarette Labeling and Advertising Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council of the City of New York to hold a hearing on the Mayor’s 2005 State of the City Address that announced the establishment of a “Commission on Construction Opportunity” and the “Building Jobs Through Building New York” initiative and on proposals from other parties that describe approaches to redress the historic and systemic denial of opportunities for minorities and women to receive their fair share of private and government contracts and employment in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Hold a hearing on the Mayor’s 2005 State of the City Address.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City of New York to allocate the Department of Parks and Recreation’s annual capital budget more equitably to all five boroughs, in that the Fiscal Year 2005 capital budget allocations only allotted 42.2% of the budget to the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island, while 57.8% is allotted to Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Allocate the Department of Parks and Recreation’s annual capital budget more equitably to all five boroughs.

Items.Title: Resolution opposing Governor Pataki’s decision to move the Jamaica office of the New York State Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance, Division of Disability Determinations, and up to 200 vital jobs, from its current location in downtown Jamaica, Queens.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Opposing Governor Pataki’s decision to move the Jamaica office of the New York State Office of Temporary and Disability Assistance.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Senate to reject passage of S. 131, the Clear Skies Act of 2005, which undermines both the substance and spirit of the Clean Air Act, one of the nation’s landmark environmental laws.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Senate to reject passage of S. 131, the Clear Skies Act of 2005.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a commission to study the feasibility of creating public/private partnerships to develop and operate job centers for immigrant day laborers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Establishing a commission to study the feasibility of creating public/private partnerships to develop and operate job centers for immigrant day laborers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to maximizing the number of eligible New Yorkers enrolled in the federal food stamp program by developing an on-line application system.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Maximizing the number of eligible New Yorkers enrolled in the federal food stamp program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to maximizing the number of eligible New Yorkers enrolled in the federal food stamp program by distributing applications to emergency feeding programs throughout New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Maximizing the number of eligible New Yorkers enrolled in the federal food stamp program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor of the State of New York to consider enacting legislation declaring psuedoephedrine, an essential ingredient in the making of methamphetamine, a controlled substance in order to restrict the of sale of over-the-counter cold medicine containing this ingredient, and further calling on the federal government to support the “Combat Meth Act of 2005.”
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Enact legislation declaring psuedoephedrine, an essential ingredient in the making of methamphetamine, a controlled substance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making the issuance of Metrocards to every first responder a requirement in order to adequately protect the public.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Making the issuance of Metrocards to every first responder a requirement in order to adequately protect the public.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon President George W. Bush and the United States Congress to maintain funding in the proposed 2006 fiscal year federal budget for the Microloan program administered by the United States Small Business Administration.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Maintain funding in the proposed FY'06 federal budget for the Microloan program administered by the US Small Business Administration.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of illegal alterations and conversions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Regulation of illegal alterations and conversions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Assembly to pass A1899 and the New York State Senate to pass S1551, legislation that would require health insurance companies doing business in the State of New York to cover the cost of colorectal screening procedures for those over 50 years of age and for those under 50 years of age who are considered at high risk for the disease.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Health insurance companies to cover the cost of colorectal screening procedures for those over 50 years of age.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to issuance of a certificate of completion for individuals working on supported scaffolds.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Issuance of a certificate of fitness for individuals working on supported scaffolds.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the United Nations’ International Conference on Population and Development Programme of Actions, also known as the “Cairo Programme of Actions,” which establishes consensus on a variety of development goals including gender equality, equity and the empowerment of women.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Support of the UNs’ International Conference on Population and Development Programme of Actions, also known as the “Cairo Programme of Actions”.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Congress to repeal the Weldon Refusal Clause, which would allow institutions to refuse to comply with existing or future laws that protect women’s access to abortion services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Congress to repeal the Weldon Refusal Clause

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Dinowitz, Greene, Millman and Towns A.1401 “An ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clearly marking certain pedestrian crosswalks in any city having a population on one million or more persons.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, clearly marking certain pedestrian crosswalks in any city having a population of one million or more. (A.1401)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Members Dinowitz, and Greene A.1442 “An ACT to dedicate the Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the Bronx as parkland.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, to dedicate the Jerome Park Resevoir tract in the Bronx as Parkland. (A.1442)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.2310 and Assembly Members Cohen and Gianaris A.3477, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the optional age fifty-five improved benefit retirement program for certain New York City members.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName:
AN ACT, the optional fifty-five improved benefit program for certain NYC members 
(S.2310. A.3477)

Smith S.1282, and Assembly Member Robinson A.2455, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the registration of property and designation of mailing address.”

Items.MatterName:
AN ACT, registration of property and designation of mailing address
(S.1282, A.2455)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Smith S.2077 and Assembly Member Cohen A.3634, “AN ACT to authorize retroactive membership in tier one of the New York City teachers’ retirement system for Rose Treiber.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, to authorize retroactive membership in tier one of the NYC teachers' retirement system for Rose Treiber S.2077, A.3634)

Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName:
Amend the General Business Law, in relation to adult commercial establishments.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S. 2516 and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz A.5273, “An Act to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairment of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.2519, “An Act to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs members of the New York City employees’ retirement system.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs. (S.2519).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senators Maltese, Fuschillo S.276, “An Act to amend the New York city charter, in relation to permitting police personnel to accept other offices and to repeal section 1129 of such charter relating thereto.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, to permit police personnel to accept other offices. (S.276)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright A.763, “An ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Manhattan to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from former owner Enola Walker, deceased, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1902, Lot No. 126 on the tax map for the borough of Manhattan.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: In Rem, Enola Walker, Manhattan. (A.763).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Wright A.828, “An ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Manhattan to Debora Unger and Anthony Marcus, notwithstanding the expiration of the two year period with in which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 2074, Lot No. 15 and Block No. 1949, Lot No. 5 on the tax map for the borough of Manhattan.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: In Rem, Debora Unger and Anthony Marcus, Manhattan. (A.828).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S. 2178 and Assembly Member Abbate A.4362, “An Act to amend the penal law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to waiving firearm license fee for certain retired officers, sheriffs, undersheriffs and deputy sheriffs of the city of New York.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, waiving firearm license fee for certain NYC retired officers, sheriffs, underesheriffs and deputy sheriffs

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1363 and Assembly Member Abbate A.2577, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to loans to members of the police pension fund.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, loans to members of police pension fund

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1954 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3870, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to payments by the correction officers’ variable supplements fund.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYC adcode in relation to payments by the correction officers' variable supplements fund (S.1954, A.3870).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1955 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3869, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of correction in cities having a population of one million or more.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of dept. of correction in cities having a pop. of one million or more

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1956 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3868, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the board of trustees of the New York city employees’ retirement system.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: To amend the NYC adcode in relation to the composition of the board of trustees of the NYC employees, retirement system (S.1956, A.3868)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1957 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3867, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability retirement of certain New York city correction members.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to disability retirement of certain NYC correction members (S.1957, A.3867)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1958 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3866, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of NYC correction dept. for ordinary disability benefits

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1960 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3923, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting certain New York city correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and to repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law relating thereto.”
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to permitting certain NYC correction members to borrow from their accumulated member contributions and repeal certain provisions of the retirement and social security law (S.1960, A.3923)
